page.title: 19Broughton Castle:Banbury (3)
page.content:
We found out that one of the bedrooms had two little doors through which you could see into the {chapel}. The Buff coat which hangs on the wall in the {Great Hall} is made of leather and it was used in the Civil War. There were some fire buckets which date back to the 18th Century. The buckets are made out of Leather they kept water or sand in them. The bedrooms which they used had fires and the fires were lit at night so they kept the buckets handy just in case it caught on fire. In the 1300 the Great Hall was the main living room of the house. The roof would have been much higher and made of timber.
Claire Jackson & Nicola Almond
